noun.description: The side of a person's or animal's body between the ribs and the hip.
The right or left side of a body of people such as an army, a naval force, or a soccer team.
examples: the left flank of the Russian Third Army

verb.description: Be situated on each side of or on one side of (someone or something)
examples: the fireplace is flanked by built-in bookshelves

origin: Late Old English, from Old French flanc, of Germanic origin.
